results.title: Short cuts [Widescreen]
results.creator_credit: Short Cuts Productions Inc, Cary Brokaw and Robert Altman
results.brief_description: A dazzling and dizzying adaptation of short stories by Raymond Carver, “Short Cuts” follows 22 Los Angeles residents whose lives intersect over the course of a few days. Anne and Howard Finnegan are preparing for their son’s birthday when the boy falls into a coma after a car accident. Meanwhile, Andy the baker, seethes with anger over the birthday cake that wasn’t claimed. Lois is a new mother who watches over her baby when not making money doing phone sex. Pilot “Stormy” Weathers takes a very literal approach to dividing up property with his ex-wife. Doreen is trying to hold on to her marriage with Earl, who is a good man on the rare occasions that he’s sober. Zoe, a classical musician, is trying to find a way to connect with her jazz singer mother. Dr. Ralph Wyman and wife, Marian, put their bickering on hold while they have dinner with couple, Stuart and Claire Kane. The stories wind around each other with just enough connecting threads to hold the tapestry together. Cast includes: Anne Archer, Bruce Davison, Peter Gallagher, Buck Henry, Jennifer Jason Leigh, Jack Lemmon, Huey Lewis, Lyle Lovett, Andie MacDowell, Matthew Modine, Julianne Moore, Chris Penn, Tim Robbins, Annie Ross, Lori Singer, Madeleine Stowe, Lili Tomlin, Tom Waits, Fred Ward, Lili Taylor, Frances McDormand and Robert Downey Jr.

results.title: Short Cuts
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Advanced Typing”.
Stresses the importance of having good posture and of having equipment and materials arranged for maximum efficiency. Demonstrates how to use tab stops, tab bar and decimal tabulator key. Shows the handling of carbon packs, use of the pressure indicator; correct method for making erasures, insertion of missing words and letters, removal of extra words and letters, typing cards, envelopes and labels, drawing vertical and horizontal lines.

results.title: Short black
results.brief_description: This tightly scripted work employs Chandleresque dialogue, noirish mise en scene and high key lighting to create a wisecracking, character driven crime story. Inanimate clay figures and controlled comic timing create characters in an absurdist style which draw viewers’ attention to the features of the genre.

results.title: Shores of Gulf St Vincent
results.brief_description: Marine life of the reefs at 80, 60 and 30 foot depths representing submerged shorelines in St. Vincent Gulf, South Australia. Shows the dense population and variety of populations found in these temperate waters.

results.title: Shore
results.creator_credit: Greg Reading, John Shaw, Don Murray and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode number 3 of Series “The Little world of Dietmar Fill”.
Where the sea meets the land we find a place of harsh extremes and constant change. Dietmar, Bibi and marine biologist Elizabeth Pope, explore the rich and varied life of the rocky seashore. Narrated by Robyn Williams.

results.title: Shoppingtown. Livingroom
results.brief_description: Two short films by Australian director, David Caesar. “Shoppingtown” (8 mins, 1987) begins with a blank screen and multiple voices on the soundtrack. Next, we are presented by a series of silent moving image portraits of customers, workers and visitors to a large suburban shopping mall. The portraits reveal the humanity behind the “faceless” mob that move around us in suburban space. With “Living Room” (22mins, 1988), Caesar extends the style of “Shoppingtown” to construct a series of portraits of people framed within their homes. From homeless youth in Kings Cross to first home-owners in the Western suburbs to shopkeepers behind their counters, “Living Room” again humanises the everyday. While the people pose for the camera, written text flashes in between portraits to further give us in insight into their thoughts and lives. By interposing video footage of home construction between the filmed sequences, the film also asks us to interrogate the meaning of “home”, “ownership” and “place”.

results.title: Shoppingtown
results.brief_description: Short Australian film by David Caesar which creates a portrait of Parramatta Shoppingtown in August 1986. Initial blank screen isolates people’s words as they voice their aspirations and understanding of happiness. Silence follows as a series of film portraits reveal the inhabitants of Shoppingtown, a shopping centre in suburban Sydney. A rapid montage of images and sounds, most prominently the sounds of the checkout scanner, denote the commercial aspect of a space which has been established in the film as communal and civic. The portraits of shoppers and mall dwellers return, ending in a portrait of the filmmakers themselves.

results.title: Shopping in Japan: an invitation to quality
results.brief_description: Retail traders in Japan offer a very wide range of quality consumer goods to the people of Japan and vistors to the country. These include goods made in both the traditional manner by craftsmen in home industries and in small vilalge factories, and those made in the new efficient industrial complexes.
